intro: Willdenowia cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf willdenowia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and parts of the Americas. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often lanceolate in shape. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Willdenowia cuspidata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
